result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dustin J Georgeson

records.addlTxt:
1:28 PM Defendant Dustin J Georgeson in court.  Attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court questions the defendant as he is appearing pro se.
Defendant is able to hire his own attorney at this time but needs additional time.
Court questions defendant how long he needs to obtain counsel.
Defendant indicates approx. 3 weeks to obtain counsel.
Case to be adjourned.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 14, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Initial Appearance set for 10/24/22 @ 1:30 p.m. in Br 3

Follow conditions of all his open bonds.
Pay $500 by next week Thursday (09-29-22) and the balance $500 the following week thereafter by Thursday (10-06-2022).

1:14 PM Defendant Dustin J Gerogeson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for State of WI. Attorney     Maxwell Bergner appears on behalf of the defendant.

Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Andrew August Mutchler states facts for anticipated charges of Bail Jumping. 
Attorney for the defendant does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed 
State requests a cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Defendant is not eligible for a public defender on this case.
Attorney for the defendant objects to cash bond or request there be payments allowed and states reasons on the record. 
Defendant makes statements to the court and willing to do a wage assignment.
Hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
